result.execSummary:
The defendant Paul R. Bender was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manuf/Deliver Schedule I, II Narcotics [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

miscConds.notes:
Work out payment plan with agent.
Payment of any court obligations and DOC supervision fees.
Work out payment plan with agent.

May not vote or serve on a jury until civil rights are restored.
No firearms.
Provide DNA sample on 5-10-16
Pay DNA surcharge.

No contact with R.O., C.V. or their immediate families.
Contact with T.L. only with agent's knowledge and prior approval.
Absolute sobriety to include no purchase, possession or consumption of alcohol or controlled substances unless prescribed by a physician and then only according to physician's orders. 
Defendant is not to be in the company of any person who is using, purchasing or possessing illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.
Defendant is not to consume or possess any prescription medication without a valid prescription.  All prescriptions shall be verified by agent.
AODA assessment followed by treatment and aftercare.

timeConds.notes:
Serve 30 days jail, commencing 5-10-16 at 7:00 pm.  No good time.
No credit.  Huber release if in compliance with the jail rules and regulations.
60 days jail STAYED! To be imposed if defendant does not complete the 780 hours community service within the first 2 years of probation.
